p: Infectious disease epidemics have substantial impacts on health care systems and economies. Mathematical models are extremely important for the purposes of planning [ 13], because the best we can do is to make decisions based on comparing the effects of various interventions on simulated epidemics (real experiments are usually impossible or unethical). For example, planners may need to decide whether to close schools [ 8, 14, 15] (and for how long to close them) or how to prioritize the use of limited supplies of vaccine [ 5].
